info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 6 at 7:49PM MDT until July 6 at 10:45PM MDT by NWS Goodland KS
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of northeast Colorado, including the following county, Yuma, northwest Kansas, including the following county, Cheyenne, and southwest Nebraska, including the following county, Dundy.
* WHEN...Until 1045 PM MDT /1145 PM CDT/.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 748 PM MDT /848 PM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wray, Benkelman, Haigler, Laird, Beecher Island, Vernon, Parks, Heartstrong, Abarr and Max.
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM MDT /1145 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Yuma, CO; Cheyenne, KS; Dundy, NE
